sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"烂，腐烂"之意。
means: rot ： 指蔬菜水果或肉类的分解、腐烂。
decay ： 通常指由良好或完美的状态自然而缓慢地变坏或完全变坏腐烂，或部分地毁坏。
decompose ： 侧重指动物或植物类物体由于内部组织的分解而导致的腐烂过程。

word_mean: 肝〔双盘〕吸虫病：羊的一种疾病，有时侵犯人，由肝片吸虫(Fasciola hepatiea)引起

sentence.Network_cn: 是内部检举和调查性报道揭露了这一腐败事实。

sentence.Network_en: Condensation will eventually cause the fabric of the building to rot away.
sentence.Network_cn: 冷凝作用将最终使建筑结构腐朽掉。

sentence.Network_en: The trees were in bad shape from dry rot.
sentence.Network_cn: 树木得了干腐病，状况堪忧。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English rotian (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch rotten; the noun (Middle English) may have come via Scandinavian

entry.def: When food, wood, or another substance rots, or when something rots it, it becomes softer and is gradually destroyed.

example.ex: If we don't unload it soon, the grain will start rotting in the silos...
example.tran: 如果我们不立刻把粮食卸下来，它们就会在筒仓里开始腐烂。

example.ex: Sugary canned drinks rot your teeth.
example.tran: 罐装的甜饮料会腐蚀牙齿。

entry.tran: （尤指木制品的）腐烂，腐败，腐朽
entry.def: If there is rot in something, especially something that is made of wood, parts of it have decayed and fallen apart.

example.ex: Investigations had revealed extensive rot in the beams under the ground floor...
example.tran: 调查发现一层地下的横梁大面积腐烂。

example.ex: Neither the timber frame nor metal chassis were protected against rot.
example.tran: 木构架和金属底盘都没有采取防腐措施。

entry.def: You can use the rot to refer to the way something gradually gets worse. For example, if you are talking about the time when the rot set in, you are talking about the time when a situation began to get steadily worse and worse.

example.ex: In many schools, the rot is beginning to set in. Standards are falling all the time...
example.tran: 很多学校的情况正开始变得越来越糟，教学水平一路下滑。

example.ex: The country's leaders are unwilling to take unpopular measures to stop the rot.
example.tran: 该国领导人不愿采取不受欢迎的措施来阻止形势恶化。

entry.tran: (尤指人在狱中)身心状况越来越糟，萎靡不振，颓废下去
entry.def: If you say that someone is being left to rot in a particular place, especially in a prison, you mean that they are being left there and their physical and mental condition is being allowed to get worse and worse.

example.ex: Most governments simply leave the long-term jobless to rot on the dole.
example.tran: 大多数政府就让那些长期失业的人领着救济金颓废度日。

entry.def: If you say that what someone is saying is rot, you mean that they are saying things that are untrue or stupid.

example.ex: What a load of pompous, pseudo-intellectual rot...
example.tran: 真是自命不凡的伪知识分子的一派胡言！

means.word_mean: 1. decay usually accompanied by an offensive odor
2. (biology) decaying caused by bacterial or fungal action

sentences.sentence: "Political prisoners are wasting away in many prisons all over the world"

sentences.en: Rot in the tree trunk caused the tree to fall.
sentences.cn: 树干的腐烂导致树倒了。

sentences.en: Dead plants rot and become part of the soil again.
sentences.cn: 枯死的植物腐烂, 又成为土壤的一部分。

jushi.english: Rot in the tree trunk caused the tree to fall.
jushi.chinese: 树干的腐烂导致树倒了。

jushi.english: Dead plants rot and become part of the soil again.
jushi.chinese: 枯死的植物腐烂，又成为土壤的一部分。

jushi.english: The rain has rotted the roof beams.
